template:
Different ways of updating UI text

Using the UIBUILDER IIFE library.

These are all different ways in which you can easily update on-page information from Node-RED data. See the HTML code and matching commented flows on the example flow tab for more details.

No-Code

These do not require any JavaScript code. They can all be driven fully from Node-RED flows.

Example (1) via uib-topic attribute on ANY HTML tag

Below this para is another that has a special attribute. The value of which matches a Node-RED topic. Send a msg with that topic to the uibuilder node and the msg.payload will be treated as HTML and applied to the para contents. Any msg.attributes will be applied to the attributes of the para.

[Default text - waiting for a msg.topic = "example1"]

Example (1a) & (1b) Form elements using uib-topic attributes



Example (2) via no-code uib-update node to any identifiable HTML tag

The age below will be updated direct from Node-RED using a uib-update node.

This is some text and I want to tell you that my age is 140.

Example (3) via <uib-var> custom web component

A remote set command is sent from Node-RED to update a uibuilder managed variable. Payload contains an HTML formatted a random quote from a web site.

(waiting for quote)

Low-Code - HTML only

These use just HTML in index.html. Either for the main logic (4) or for the filters. The code in each case is minimal, consider these to be low-code examples.

Example (5) via <uib-var> custom web component with filter

Each of the following is set by the same uibuilder managed variable. In this case filter formats the number with a fixed number of decimal places.

[waiting for egfilter value] (no filter, just the value)
[waiting for egfilter value] (myFilter fn applied. 0DP)
[waiting for egfilter value] (myFilter fn with extra param (2) applied. 2DP)

Example (6) via <uib-var> custom web component using topic monitor

Rather like example 1, this watches for a msg from Node-RED with the topic mytopic/#1, The msg payload replaces the slot content with TEXT (since we haven't used the optional type="html" attribute).

[waiting for egtopic/#1 value]

Example (7) <uib-var> using the attribute type="list"

Here we listen for a msg from Node-RED with the topic 'mytopic/#7' where the payload contains an array of text entries. Each entry becomes a new list entry.

[waiting for egtopic/#7 value]

Example (8) <uib-var> using the attribute type="table"

Here we listen for a msg from Node-RED with the topic 'mytopic/#8' where the payload contains an array of object entries. Each entry becomes a new row in a table. Each property of each entry becomes a column in the table. The first entry defines the columns.

[waiting for egtopic/#8 value]

Low-Code - Front-end JavaScript in index.js

These use some front-end JavaScript code in index.js. The code in each case is minimal, consider these to be low-code examples.

Example (4) via front-end (browser) code

The temperature below will be updated direct from Node-RED using local front-end code in index.js

The temperature today is -20â„ƒ.

Other <uib-var> tests

These are tests to make sure that the component logic is working correctly. However, they also show alternative ways of working with the component. See the HTML code for details of what is being displayed. Only filter attributes are used to control the content in these. No JavaScript is required for any of these.

  • [[...]] Only a filter, no var or topic. UIBUILDER version uibuilder.get.
  • [[...]] Only a filter. UIBUILDER version shortcut get.
  • Format number uibuilder.formatNumber and apply locale formatting
    [...] Apply lang filter using default Locale ([...])
    [...] Apply German locale to formatted number
    [...] Apply the yen filter to give a formatted currency.
  • [...] Fn in an object, no function arguments
  • [...] Fn in an object, with arguments
  • [...] Fn in an object, with empty arguments
  • [...] Fn in an object, with global variables as function arguments

These apply filter functions to a managed variable or topic

  • [...] Variable + filter, tag arguments in a different order
  • [...] Topic + filter, tag arguments in a different order
